sentences: Mateo! Como estas chico! Just in time too. We finally got those sugar skulls your abuelita has been asking for. Estas aqui to pick them up?
Ah I see. Well if you scratch my back then I'll scratch your hombre, eh?
You see the water from the fountain stopped running this morning... I’d fix it pero mi amor said I should stop doing so much physical labor. Could you help me?
Perfecto! Nomas que I need your help with something.
No? Pues Perfecto! You can help me with something then.
The water from that fountain stopped running this morning.. I’d fix it pero mi amor said I should doing so many physical cosas. Could you help me?
Now it’s stuck on the roof of the store. Puedes ayudar getting the chancla off of the roof?
Gracias Matteo. You’re a lifesaver. No sabes how much you’re helping Amelia. Those blisters on her feet are terrible.
I’m sure you can get it down somehow. A mejor you can kick it down with a ball or algo. Soy seguro you’ll figure it out.
No preocupes then. Cuando tienes tiempo.
Como estas Mateo. How's the fountain problema going?
Si necesitas ayuda? Try hitting the fountain. I’m sure it’ll fall off si hagas.
Mateo, que magnifico! Gracias por todo. Se mira lindo!
Aqui son los sugar skulls. Make sure they find a good place with your abuela. What am I saying, I’m sure she will if it’s for her Oscar.

Ayyy Oscar.  Recuerdo los dias cuando we were just kids running around town for horas y horas. Ja we would go around kicking balones around seeing whatever we could break. You remind me a lot like him little Mateo.
Gracias Mijo. Get those calaveras to your sweet abuelita.
Gracias Mateo... make sure your abuelita get her skulls.
